note.p: Education: Padua; MD; incorporated at Oxford (1695)

Career: Herd-boy to the Episcopalian Minister of Caerlaverock, who paid for his education; First Physician to William III and Queen Anne (1690); was at the Siege of Limerick and the Battle of the Boyne; MP for Dumfries burghs in the Scottish Parliament (1710-death); benefactor of the parish of Caerlaverock
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; Foster
Notes: Proposed by Sir John Hoskins
